trans-unit.source: Stores a set of four floating-point numbers that represent the location and size of a rectangle.
For more advanced region functions, use a <xref href="System.Drawing.Region"></xref> object.
A rectangle is defined by its width, height, and upper-left corner.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> class with the specified location and size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.PointF"></xref> that represents the upper-left corner of the rectangular region.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.SizeF"></xref> that represents the width and height of the rectangular region.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> class with the specified location and size.
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.

Gets the y-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Y"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Height"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF.Bottom%2A> value represents the y-coordinate of the first point at the bottom edge of the rectangle that is not contained in the rectangle.

The y-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Y"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Height"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
Determines if the specified point is contained within this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.PointF"></xref> to test.
This method returns `true` if the point represented by the pt parameter is contained within this structure; otherwise `false`.
Determines if the rectangular region represented by rect is entirely contained within this structure.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to test.
This method returns `true` if the rectangular region represented by rect is entirely contained within the rectangular region represented by this ; otherwise `false`.
Determines if the specified point is contained within this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of the point to test.
The y-coordinate of the point to test.
This method returns `true` if the point defined by x and y is contained within this structure; otherwise `false`.
Represents an instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> class with its members uninitialized.
The members of the new <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF> are left uninitialized.
Tests whether obj is a with the same location and size of this .
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to test.
This method returns `true` if obj is a and its `X`, `Y`, `Width`, and `Height` properties are equal to the corresponding properties of this ; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure with upper-left corner and lower-right corner at the specified locations.
This method creates a <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF> with the specified upper-left and lower-right corners.
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangular region.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangular region.
The x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangular region.
The y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the rectangular region.
The new <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> that this method creates.
Gets the hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
For information about the use of hash codes, see `Object.GetHashCode`.
The hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref>.
Gets or sets the height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
Enlarges this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> by the specified amount.
This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it.
The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis.

For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is inflated by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
The amount to inflate this rectangle.
Enlarges this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure by the specified amount.
This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it.
The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis.

For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is inflated by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
If either `x` or `y` is negative, the <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF> is deflated in the corresponding direction.
The amount to inflate this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure horizontally.
The amount to inflate this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure vertically.
Creates and returns an enlarged copy of the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The copy is enlarged by the specified amount and the original rectangle remains unmodified.
This method makes a copy of `rect`, enlarges the copy, and then returns the enlarged copy.
The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis.

For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is inflated by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to be copied.
This rectangle is not modified.
The amount to enlarge the copy of the rectangle horizontally.
The amount to enlarge the copy of the rectangle vertically.
The enlarged <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that represents the intersection of two rectangles.
If there is no intersection, and empty <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> is returned.
A rectangle to intersect.
A rectangle to intersect.
A third <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure the size of which represents the overlapped area of the two specified rectangles.
Replaces this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure with the intersection of itself and the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The rectangle to intersect.
Determines if this rectangle intersects with rect.
The rectangle to test.
This method returns `true` if there is any intersection.

Tests whether the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Width"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Height"></xref> property of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> has a value of zero.

This property returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Width"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Height"></xref> property of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> has a value of zero; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the x-coordinate of the left edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of the left edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.PointF"></xref> that represents the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
Adjusts the location of this rectangle by the specified amount.
The amount to offset the location.
Adjusts the location of this rectangle by the specified amount.
The amount to offset the location horizontally.
The amount to offset the location vertically.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structures have equal location and size.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that is to the left of the equality operator.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that is to the right of the equality operator.

This operator returns `true` if the two specified <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structures have equal <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Y"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Width"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Height"></xref> properties.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structures differ in location or size.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that is to the left of the inequality operator.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that is to the right of the inequality operator.

This operator returns `true` if any of the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.X"></xref> , <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Y"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Width"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Height"></xref> properties of the two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures are unequal; otherwise `false`.

Gets the x-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Width"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The <xref:System.Drawing.RectangleF.Right%2A> value represents the x-coordinate of the first point at the right edge of the rectangle that is not contained in the rectangle.

The x-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF.Width"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the size of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.SizeF"></xref> that represents the width and height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
Gets the y-coordinate of the top edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the top edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
Converts the `Location` and <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to a human-readable string.
A string that contains the position, width, and height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
For example, "{X=20, Y=20, Width=100, Height=50}".
Creates the smallest possible third rectangle that can contain both of two rectangles that form a union.

When one of the two rectangles is empty, meaning all of its values are zero, the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Union%2A> method returns a rectangle with a starting point of (0, 0), and the height and width of the non-empty rectangle.
For example, if you have two rectangles A = (0, 0; 0, 0) and B = (1, 1; 2, 2), then the union of A and B is (0, 0; 2, 2).
A rectangle to union.
A rectangle to union.
A third <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that contains both of the two rectangles that form the union.
Gets or sets the width of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The width of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
